text:
We love this one.  Every where I have taken it everybody raves about it.  I do reduce the ranch dressing to 1/2 c, as I don't like that much ranch flavor.  I also don't cook it on the stove top.  I blend the cream cheese together and then slowly incorporate the ranch and hot sauce then pour over the chicken and cheese in a 9 x 13 pan mix well and top with a little more cheese and then bake at 375 degrees for 20 minutes or until bubbly.  Love it - will continue to make it for many years to come!

text:
People loved this dip.  I made it as-stated, except I doubled it and used 4 6-oz bags of Tyson pre-cooked chicken breast strips (not canned).  I also used less than a cup of cheddar cheese, mixed in.  Everything else was exact for a doubled recipe.  I think doubling it was too much for a small Superbowl party, because it was such a heavy and salty dip.  Best to leave people wanting more.  Also, the dipper of choice was Fritos scoops (yum!) or celery.  The chicken in a biscuit crackers made this just too over-the-top salty.  I would make this again.

text:
HAH!  I made this this morning for my husband to take to work - Super Bowl Snack Day.  One hour later, he's e-mailing me because EVERYONE wants the recipe!  Definitely a keeper!  I did take some other reviewers' suggestions.  I used half Ranch and half Blue Cheese dressing, used cooked shredded chicken, and I used Texas Pete's Wing Sauce and sharp cheddar cheese.  I baked it in the oven for about 30 minutes until it was bubbly, and served it with Aldis brand "Entertainment Crackers" and celery sticks.  Thanks so much for sharing!  Can't wait to make it again!  The only thing I might do differently is add a bit more chicken.  Other than that, it was perfect.

text:
Made this for Christmas.  This is very easy to make.  I made a few substitutions, starting w/the fact that I used 2 large boneless, skinless chicken breasts instead of canned chicken due to personal preference.  Then I shredded the chicken using 2 forks per breast until it was finely shredded (mind you, after it was boiled!), then I added 1 tbsp. of garlic pepper, and used Frank's Buffalo wing sauce instead of the standard hot sauce.  I was told by a few people that this was the best dip they ever had!!!

text:
i made this dip for a christmas eve get together with my family and everyone wanted the recipe. it was so good and quick for a party. i don't transfer this to a slow cooker i just let it sit in a covered pot for about 10 minutes until the cheese is all melted. also so it's not so chunky when you put the chicken and hot sauce in the pan break up the chicken a little bit that way it's more of a dip instead of a topping. people are now telling me that i need to bring it to the new years eve party lol. great recipe thanks for sharing. I re-made this recipe for new years but i made it a layered dip. I would not recommend it. no one at any of it because it tasted funny. if you are going to make this def go with the dip style not the layering.

This dip was a big hit at my Christmas party this year! It makes a good bit, so it's excellent for a large crowd.  I cut back to 1/2 cup on the hot sauce (store brand-not Frank's), and it was just enough heat...not so overwhelming. CHOOTOI

city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
Great recipe. Everybody loves it!

I did it with:
2 cans 10 oz chicken chunks (white meat only)
1 cup frank's WING sauce
2 cups HOT PEPPER cheese, shredded
1 cup SPICY RANCH
2 8 oz. sticks of cream cheese
1/5 stick of butter/margarine

I put the chicken (well-drained) into a small skillet with a bit of butter, then added the sauce and cooked on medium high for 5-6 minutes.

At the same time, I microwaved the cream cheese for 2 minutes in the same measuring cup I had used for the sauce. Then I put the cream cheese in a round glass baking dish and mixed in the ranch. I mixed in 1 cup of shredded cheese, then poured the chicken and sauce on top. I put the rest of the cheese on top of that, then crumbled a handful of ritz toasted chips (southwest ranch flavor) on top. I covered the dish and baked at 350 for 23 minutes. 

Served with ritz toasted chips (southwest ranch) and chicken 'n' biscuit crackers.

text:
This dip was amazing! I only used one packaged of cream cheese, cut down the ranch and spread it on the bottom of a 9x9 pan. I boiled chicken breast in chicken stock and a little hot sauce for about 40 min until tender. I then shredded the chicken and mixed in Wing Sauce rather than pepper sauce. I spread it over the cream cheese mixture and topped it with Monteray Jack and Cheddar cheese. I popped it in the oven for about 25 min. until golden brown and bubbly. Everyone loved it! And it wasn't too spicey, the ranch and cream cheese was a great offset. My boyfriend, who hates anything spicey, was the biggest fan of all! This is now on my "best recipes" list!

This is a good one...the last time I made it during a family get together, it literally lasted only 4 minutes. text:
Wow - great! Like this dip needs another rave review. Pretty darn terrific and it does tastes like buffalo wings. Like some other reviewers suggested, I did not add the cheese. I totally agree it is not needed as it is so creamy and rich anyway. Surprisingly, I liked it better with celery than crackers, but that is how I eat my wings so I guess that makes sense. Thank you for a new addition to my old and boring dip collection. UPDATE: Someone in an earlier review commented on how her quests asked if this was tuna. Well, we just tried some of the leftovers cold from the refrigerator and it tasted more like tuna than buffalo chicken. We didn't like it nearly as much. Very weird. Maybe is has to do with the chicken being canned like tuna. In the future we will either eat it warm as recommended or I might try it with chicken that didn't come out of a can.

text:
I used to pre-make it in a saucepan but it isn't necessary an even easier way is spread 8 oz cream cheese at bottom of pan, layer with 1/2 cup buffalo wing sauce, 1/2 cup blue cheese and then 10 oz of canned chix, top with 1 1/2 cups cheese and bake for 20-25 minutes at 350.

text:
Wow, this was quite a hit at the Superbowl part!  There were about 40 people at the party and almost everyone commented on how much they liked this dip.  I even had to give out the recipe several times because the wives said that their husbands insist that they learn how to make this.  The only changes I made were to use 3 chicken breasts (boiled then shredded), 1/2 cup ranch and 1/2 cup bleu cheese, and no cheddar cheese.  I even had the cheddar cheese in the refrigerator, but I really did not think that the dip needed it because it was so rich already.  The dip did not turn greasy AT ALL.  Maybe this is because I didn't use any cheddar.  I will definitely be making this for my next get-together!

city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
I have made this recipes a number of times and get great reviews from all who try it.  I usually do 1/2 ranch dressing and 1/2 blue cheese dressing and omit the cheddar cheese but add blue cheese crumbles.  To make it super simple I purchase 2 - 3 fried chicken breasts at the deli section of the supermarket, remove the crispy skin and bones, then chop up the meat into small pieces.  I think that the fresh meat tastes better than canned which I tried once.  I find that I like it best with celery and go through two whole stocks each time I serve it.  I usually serve it in a mini crock pot to keep it warm, but be sure and watch that it doesn't over cook and you'll need to stir it once in a while.  Thanks for this tasty recipe.

text:
I've made this for several parties and it's a hit everytime.  It doesn't look the prettiest, but tastes great with tortilla chips.  I usually use shredded chicken that is cooked in a crockpot with a can of chipotle peppers.  You can then chop up some of the peppers with the chicken for some added flavor.  Using lower fat cream cheese and ranch help a little with the nutritional numbers and you can't taste the difference.  Mini crockpots work great for keeping the dip warm during the party.

city:

region:
None
country:
None
text:
I can't exactly rate this recipe, because I haven't tried it with this cooking method, but the ingredients are almost identical to the one that I use, quite frequently.  I do cook my own chciken, rather than use the canned as instructed, but maybe in a pinch I would try the canned.  I do like the idea of combining the chicken with the hot sauce prior to mixing it all together.  Maybe next time I'll try that.  I use blue cheese dressing, rather than ranch - my recipe says "either, or."  My recipe combines all of the ingredients and putting in a baking dish, then baking the mixture for about 20-30 minutes at 350 degrees, or until sharp cheese is melted.  It doesn't call for putting an extra layer of cheese on top.  Before serving though, I sprinkle a layer of chopped fresh celery on the top of the baked dip, just to give that final "buffalo wing" touch, and serve it with tortilla chips, although wheat thins work nicely, too.  I have also, on occasion, just placed a bowl of the chopped celery alongside, for those that want it.  Its a wonderful dip that gets rave reviews, and it sure does satisfy that "buffalo wing" craving, with a lot less mess.  Hot sauce, of course can be added to suit your heat tolerance, and any of the wing sauces work.

Used a fresh chicken breast, roasted in the oven

Heated in microwave. Best dip ever!

None
text:
This is an easy recipe that makes  a great dip.  For easier prep make sure you cut the cream cheese into cubes and I even add a little sour cream to make sure it's not too spicy (if you want it on the mild side so everyone will enjoy it).  I also recommend the Franks Red Hot 'Buffalo Wings' sauce instead of the original as that is more of the flavor most people expect!  Remember to add the hot sauce to taste as once you add too much you'll need to have sour cream or even more cream cheese to try and tone it down.

text:
I'm always asked to bring this dip to parties - everyone loves it.  I make this in a large dutch oven on the stove and then transfer to a baking dish for about 30 minutes in the oven at 350.  I use good bleu cheese dressing (like Marie's) instead of the ranch, and add one cup of the shredded cheddar to the dip while it's still on the stove and don't top the dip with it (tends to get rubbery as it cools off).  Also best served with Frito's Scoops.

I used half a rotisserie chicken finely diced /shredded.  Instead of mixing all ingredients together I layered the mixed cream cheese and ranch on bottom of an 8x8 baking dish then the chicken and hot sauce mixture topped with the cheese and heat through. Next time I'm going to try putting the cheese in between the layers because once the dish started to cool it was difficult to scoop with chips (chips kept breaking). Everybody raved about it and it's great with Fritos.

Update:
Cheese in the middle is way better.

text:
This is how I ensure this dip comes out to 5 stars EVERY TIME:
*USE REAL CHICKEN- about three good-sized breasts.  cook it. Either boil it, like some have suggested, or what I like to do is cook it in a pan on the stove with about half a bottle of the Frank's red hot sauce. 
*USE CHUNKY BLUE CHEESE DRESSING- instead of Ranch. Marie's is a great brand to use. Use the whole bottle. 
Doing these two things brings this 3 star recipe to a 5 star recipe easily!!

Who cares what color it is. This stuff is amazing! Easy to tweak to make to your liking. I used 2 grilled chicken breasts. They were huge. I used half ranch and half blue cheese and lower fat cream cheese. I put in extra hot sauce because we like things spicy. photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/2887908.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
Classic Buffalo Chicken Dip recipe. I only made a couple of changes. I, too, don't prefer canned meats to fresh, and boiled and shredded a pound of chicken breasts instead. I also switched out the ranch with Bleu cheese, because that's what you eat with chicken wings! Instead of cooking it in a slow cooker, I mix everything together and heat it through in a skillet, then transfer it to a baking dish, cover it in the cheddar cheese (always freshly grated, of course) then pop it in the broiler for 2-4 minutes until the cheese is lightly browned. Delicious, and always popular at parties! I like to serve it with Tostitos scoops. I've made a hundred times, and will make 1000 more!

Yup, I was the last person in America to have heard of this recipe, apparently.  I made it for the family while they all watched some big football game, and it was by far the star of the show. userID:

Display Name:
thatem
isPro:

2

recipesCount:

reviewsCount:

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/5674161.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
I have made this recipe many and it's always a favorite.  I have modified it by using the rotisserie chicken at the grocery store.  This is an excellent short cut.  If you have a Kroger's nearby, I always use their low fat southwestern ranch dressing.  I also use their fiesta blend cheese with hot pepper in the mix or the habenaro brand if I can find it.  I use frank's hot sauce, but I also put a few tablespoons of specialty hot sauce that my kids get me for Christmas.  I don't use the slow cooker, but make it in the over on 350 for 20 minutes.  If I remember to by some, I sometimes sprinkle the French onions around the sides or mix it into the cheese before sprinkling it on top.

city:

region:
None
country:
None
text:
I didn't care much for this dip but my family loved it and ate all of it.  I used chicken breasts that I had roasted in the oven.  I also used only half of the cream cheese and substituted wing sauce in place of the hot sauce.  It was a bit bland so I added some crushed garlic to add some punch.  The next time I make this I would use an alternative to ranch dressing as I found it gave it a strange taste - maybe a combo of sour cream and mayo.  I baked it in the oven and did not get the greasiness that other reviewers have reported.   Based strictly on the reviews of my family, one of whom called me the next day to say she was still thinking about it, it is a great 5 star recipe.  With some further tweaking I may upgrade my own personal rating....we'll see!

https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/5674130.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
I've made this many times when looking for something to do with cooked chicken (not canned). I do follow many of Scout99's tips which work great. I usually just make a small amount in a casserole dish, layering the cream cheese (actually used the whipped type) and blue cheese dressing, which works well here. Then I mix the chicken with some bottled buffalo chicken sauce, layer that with more of the cream cheese mixture, then top with whatever cheese you prefer. (I used a Mexican blend this time.) I scoop out some, top with choppped scallions and had with crackers. It is very rich, so a little goes a long way. Thanks NUNPUNCH for the great recipe, and Scout99 for the helpful hints!

text:
Tried this over the weekend for a party we had. It was a HUGE hit! The guests loved it, even my kids loved it, including the five year old! I think next time I will exchange the chicken for bacon, and maybe add a little liquid smoke for a little more depth. I baked it rather than used the crockpot, since I had other things going at the same time. The only issue I really had with it was the cream cheese kind of "curdled" so the dip had lil bits of it rather than everything mixing smoothly. I used and electric mixer so I am not sure what happened.
Update: Made it again, with bacon. Still super yummy, although a little salty. Still a hit.

city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
I make this recipe a little bit different. I boil the chicken for 20 minutes, shred it, then boil for another 20 minutes. Meanwhile, I put the cream cheese on the bottom of the deep dish and mix together the Frank's Red Hot hot sauce and the French* dressing. After, I mix the chicken in a bowl with the dressing, shredded cheddar cheese and hot sauce and pour it over the cream cheese. After, I put more cheddar cheese on top and put it in the oven for 15 minutes. Ritz crackers are the best to use:)

city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
This was really good with some minor modifications, based upon previous reviewers' advice.  I used two packages of light cream cheese and spread it in the bottom of a pie plate.  I then mixed the chicken (I used Costco's grilled chicken strips) with the Frank's Red Hot Buffalo Sauce and put it on top of the cream cheese layer. I then put blue cheese dressing on top of the chicken and then two cups of shredded cheddar on the blue cheese dressing.  I baked it at 425 for 15 minutes and it was awesome.  I served it with Frito Scoops.  Everyone at our Super Bowl party loved it.

Display Name:
Cynthia LaHue
isPro:

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/2262521.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
Very good recipe.  Went over very well at the gathering I took it to, so much so that I have been elected to make it every time!  I used Frank's Red Hot, store brand cream cheese, Hidden Valley ranch, Sargento off-the-block shredded mild cheddar, and Swanson canned chicken breast meat (Not chunk.  I only wanted whole pieces of white breast meat.  Although I am extremely picky with meat and the thought of using canned chicken grossed me out, I would use this again and not even think about cooking my own chicken.  Too much work and the texture of the canned chicken was perfect for dip.) The only variation that I made was dumping the entire bag cheese in.  I wish I had just stuck to the amount listed in the recipe because it altered the texture and made it way to thick for my liking.  Next time I will be sticking to the recipe as written.

text:
This recipe called for canned chicken, because I was going by memory I accidentally bought fresh chicken tenders and it was about 2 or 3 oz more than it called for, but it worked out in my favor.  After it was cooked, I tore the chicken using a knife and fork so it would have that shredded texture.  I did not move it to a slow cooker as it suggested, but allowed it to simmer on low heat or until all shredded cheese was melted. I took it to a party and it was a huge hit! No leftovers! I brought crackers (Club crackers) they worked pretty good :)

text:
I thought this recipe was ok, but I'm giving it 4 stars because everyone loved it!  I triped the recipe to make an entire crockpot full for a party.  I made two changes: I only used 2.5 cups of dressing for the entire 3x recipe, and 4 blocks of cream cheese.  This made the dip more chunky.  I also added in a container of bleu cheese at the end so there were chunks of bleu cheese.  To make the dip more appealing for my taste, I'd add something in it to make varying textures, such as stirring diced celery or scallions into the dip at the end, right before serving.  However, even without that change, there was no dip left at the end of the night.  Men really liked it.  Buy lots of crackers or Tostitos Scoops though, the men didn't eat much celery!

This dip is delicious!  I've made it many times for parties and never bring any home.  Instead of canned chicken I use chicken breasts that I've cooked the day before in the slow cooker and shredded.  I don't put the cheddar cheese in because some other reviewers said it made the dip greasy and really it is very rich even without it. country:

text:
I'll give 2 instead of 1 star after making this only because others liked it. I'll never make THIS recipe again. I don't like my dip chunky and having to spoon out and spooning out with difficulty.  If the cream cheese isn't kept hot it will re-solidify. That and having to spoon off the oil that rose to the top from the melted cream cheese was ridiculous. I kind of knew before hand when it called for serving it in a crock pot! How many dips do you have to serve in a crock pot and do you really want your guests sticking their hands into your crock pot, breaking crackers and getting dip on their sleeves? 
The taste was okay if you like cream cheese. But this highlights a problem with Allrecipes - 2700 reviews on this recipe and very few other buffalo chicken dips recipes. I came across another this morning using sour cream in place of half the cream cheese.  I'll make this again with better ingredients.

Very good base recipe, but I made a few changes. I used rotisserie chicken.  I "marinated" the chicken with the buffalo sauce in a ziploc overnight (normally I don't have time for this step but I did this time and it was even better). I also used half ranch dressing and half blue cheese dressing and added blue cheese crumbles on top. Turned out great!

Rating:

dateLastModified:

Display Name:

https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/1426090.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
I liked the dip, and so did EVERYONE else at my son's football team tailgate party. Trying to keep things easy, I decided to do it all in my slow-cooker. 
Turn it on low. Place cream cheese (straight from refrigerator), ranch, and pepper sauce in cooker. While that began to soften, I started to chop my chicken breasts...sorry, not a fan of the can. Actually, I used my mini chopper to get it superfine for the dip. 
After the chicken is shredded, add it and half the cheese to the softened items in the crock pot, stir to incorporate it all, top with remaining cheese, crank it up until the cheese on top gets bubbly, then bring back down to keep warm setting. One dish PERFECTION!

text:
A great starting point! I have made this multiple times, and it is always hit! However, I change mine a decent amount. In my opinion, there is too much of the "sauce" items and not enough chicken in the original recipe. Last time, I added extra chicken AND reduced cream cheese and ranch. Plus, I hardly add any cheese to this recipe - I just don't think it's necessary. Like I said before, a great starter recipe! Just change it to your own taste!

text:
I make this dip for almost every get together we attend.  I never come home with any and I typically make a double or triple amount.

The one variation I do which makes it easier is to simply dump all the ingredients into the kitchen aid and mix (saving about 1/4 the cheese out) and dump it into a pan and bake it at 350 for 30 min (or until bubbly) and then put the remaining cheese on top and bake until bubbly again.  It turns out great and I don't have to stand at the stove top.

This is a terrific dip!  I also dislike canned chicken so I season chicken thighs (with skin) with salt/pepper/garlic powder and bake until they are done (several hours but with the skin it doesn't dry out). After cooking it a few times, I've made these modifications: 1) roast the chicken myself (about 1 lb); 2) only used half of the cream cheese; 3) only used 1/3 of the pepper sauce. The original recipe is good, but with my modification it tasted even better.

text:
Just came home from Christmas with the family and this was a huge hit!  I also poached three chicken breasts and shredded them.  Then i mixed the cream cheese, 1.5 cups of Franks (we like spicy), the cheddar and ranch and just poured everything in a casserole dish.  Didn't feel up to baking last night so i refrigerated the mixture and cooked this morning at about 350 till bubbly.  Still warm when i arrived and after the first taste, everyone loved it.  When I make it for myself i will add blue cheese crumbles at the end (i thought about substituting blue cheese dressing for ranch but i think the tang of ranch went well with the mix).  

Thanks for this one!

text:
We all thought this was quite good.  I used a rotisserie chicken, meat shredded, as per another reviewer (I think canned meat is gross); subbed blue cheese dressing for the ranch (tho I love ranch and think that would be just as good) and put the chicken mixture in a baking dish, topped with the cheddar and baked until the cheese melted (rather than mess with the crock pot).  Served with Fritos Scoops and celery sticks, and it was perfect for the Super Bowl.  It's a nice change from the usual spinach dip or RoTel queso dip.

city:

region:

country:
None
text:
This dip is really great and everyone loves when I make it.  I do change a few things though. For the chicken I usually roast it in the oven the day before I will make the dip.  I coat it with olive oil and garlic and then sprinkle it with williams and sonoma's chili lime rub.  Squeeze the juice of one lemon and one lime over it and roast at 350deg f for 40 minutes.  Also for the dip i just cook it in the oven in a pyrex pie dish and i sprinkle the top with some smoked paprika for color.

country:

text:
My favorite appetizer recipe!  I have made this so many times, and it is always the hit of the party, with lots of recipe requests.  I love the recipe as is, but I have varied the recipe at times.  I prefer it with blue cheese dressing, for a more pungent flavor, and I have used light dressing and light cream cheese to reduce the fat (it is not the healthiest recipe!), no matter what it always turns out great. I like to serve it with carrots, celery, fritos scoops and tortilla chips.

text:
This is an absolutely favorite of ours! I've made it for all of my extended families and for football game parties and for work events and everyone raves about it and asks me for the recipe. It's extremely straightforward and easy to make. I prefer using chicken breast instead of canned chicken so I use a couple breasts and boil and shred them first. I combine the cream cheese, ranch dressing, hot sauce and cheddar cheese in the crock pot until smooth and then add in my chicken. Works wonderfully and is easy to transport.

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/5677173.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
I've now made this twice and the first time I used ranch dressing and chicken breast that I cooked and shredded myself.  The second time I used blue cheese dressing and canned chicken.  I like the taste of the blue cheese better.  I'm not a fan of canned chicken, but it was okay in a pinch.  I used Frank's sauce, and it wasn't hot enough so I put in a few drops of XXX habanero sauce to kick it up and it's perfect.    Oh, also, I put all the ingredients in a small crock pot with the cream cheese and fresh shredded cheddar on the bottom.  I then just throw in the rest of the ingredients and stir it after the first half hour.  I then stir it again in another 30 minutes.  It's warm and ready to eat in another hour (so approximately 2 hours total) with tortilla chips.

None
country:
None
text:
Excellent dip that is adjustable to personal heat levels.  I mixed all ingredients together in a skillet over low to medium heat to allow cream cheese to melt consistently - I absolutely HATE trying to mix anything with cream cheese, so this way proved to have less frustration for me.  After the cream cheese was evenly distrubuted throughout the chicken/sauce mix, I moved everything to a casserole dish, topped with remaining cheese and baked at 350 for about 20 minutes.  Delicious!

text:
This is the perfect recipe for any night with a couple of friends! I like to up the hot sauce (I use Louisiana Crystal) to a full cup. I just soften the cream cheese in the microwave and mix all the ingredients together in a bowl (I like to use about a pound of fresh, boiled and shredded chicken breasts). Then I transfer to a baking dish and sprinkle with more shredded cheddar. Bake it for about 20 minutes on 350 or so and let it cool for a good 10 minutes. My friends and I crave this all the time! Perfect with Utz's tortilla chips!

city:

region:
None
country:
None
text:
I really do love this recipe.  It's a great alternative to wings (which my friends absolutely love), without all the mess.  I tried this recipe once without changing a thing -- it was delicious.  I then tried it with pan-fried thin-sliced chicken breasts instead of canned chicken.  I also used Frank's Red Hot Wings sauce for 1/2 cup, then Frank's Red Hot Extra Hot sauce for 1/4 cup -- turned out very well, but honestly, nobody would notice the difference except for those who are very particular about canned chicken (it's usually the smell that turns people off -- smells a lot like canned tuna!).  I've also done half Ranch/half blue cheese... either way is very good.  Bottom line is:  this is a great dip, and will undoubtedly be a hit at any get-together.  Enjoy!  Side note:  instead of crackers, this dip is great with tortilla chips!

text:
This dip is amazing!  I make my own changes, though.  I boil two chicken breasts instead of the canned, I use blue cheese dressing instead of Ranch, and the hot sauce I use is Nance's Chicken Wing Sauce.  I don't really measure the cheese, I just use a couple of handfuls.  I brought this to a party and heated up portions in the microwave and it was gone quick.  Remember to bring plenty of Fritos or tortilla chips.  Goes well with Ritz crackers too.  YUMMMMMMMMMM

Fantastic. I make this pretty regularly because it's delicious and you can easily keep it in the fridge and heat up chunks of it over the next week to eat for snacks/lunch. I use a cup and a half of hot sauce, just mix the cheese in, and boil chicken before hand and then shred it with my hands. text:
I've been making this for a few years now and every time it's soooo yummy!  I've made it with boiled/shredded chicken breasts, canned chicken and even a can of black beans to make a vegetarian option.  I always use Frank's Buffalo Wing Sauce, neufchatel cheese, blue cheese instead of ranch and shred my own block 2% colby/jack cheese.  I would highly recommend like others shredding from a block, it really does cut down on the grease.   Enjoy!

Would probably give it 3 1/2 stars only because I changed the recipe considerably and it was excellent. Made this for superbowl last night and it was gobbled up. city:

region:
None
country:
None
text:
This was good, but not great.  I don't get the crock pot thing because unless you've got a smallish one I just can't see this working in something so big.  A fondue pot perhaps.  I just left it in the saucepan on simmer and stirred occasionally.  It does, IMO, really need to be warm - I took a glob out of the pan to take into another room, it started cooling off, and it just wasn't any good that way.  I used both fat free cream cheese and cheddar cheese (as I always do), and the packaged ranch.  But other than the fat issue, I *though* I had made it as is.  Except several days later I was looking at the recipe again and realized I'd only used half the cream cheese - I think I was staring too much at that 8 oz instead of the 2 in front of it.  (That's a screw-up on the last two recipes I've done - getting senile I guess.)  But it still was pretty good anyway and I'd be curious what it's like with the proper amount.  Definitely thought it better on crackers and not on celery.  Can't say as I like the tortilla idea.  This whole recipe goes a long way.

https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/940509.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
A complete hit! I substitute the cans of chicken by simmering 2 whole boneless chicken breasts in chicken broth and garlic, for 10 minutes or until chicken is juicy and tender. I use 2 forks (one in each hand) to pull and shred the meat perfectly. I substitute the Ranch dressing with Bleu Cheese dressing. l don't measure the hot sauce, I only add to taste. In my humble opinion, I find that Texas Pete hot sauce adds less 'vinegary' taste than the other leading brand name hot sauce. The recipe does tend to have oils come to the surface. It may be the cheese or it may be the dressing. I just blot orangey oils with a paper towel and serve. This appetizers gets rave reviews everytime!

text:
Awesome!  I made this for a game night & it was a hit.  Instead of canned chicken, I roasted one large split breast & used the meat from that.  I also added a bit more ranch & Franks Hot Sauce (maybe 2-3 T more each).  I also added a little chili powder- about 1 teaspoon.  Served it with celery sticks, carrot sticks & tortilla chips.  After heating everything together in the skillet, I transferred to a crockpot & kept it on warm... no problems.  Will definitely make again for New Years Eve get together.

text:
Wow this was soooooo good! I made it for a football party and everyone loved it! I got many requests for the recipe! I didn't use canned chicken either. I've never had it before and I was too scared to try it now. lol! I made a big gumbo for the party so I just boiled 3 extra chicken breasts. Perfect amount. The only other thing I did different was I used more than 3/4 cup hot sauce, more like 1 1/4 cup. I also did not find the need to use all the cheese, I used just about a handful. I couldn't find Frank's so I ended up using Louisiana wing sauce, which was awesome! I threw it all in the slow cooker and didn't use the stovetop at all except to boil the chicken. I served it with Tostitos Scoops! Just writing this review makes me want to make some right now!

This is not my favorite dip, but bf really loves it, and everyone at the party we brought it to really enjoyed it as well.  I'd never made it myself but have had it at other parties.  Bf promised the hostess we'd make this, so I had to go hunting for the recipe.  This is the one!  We kept it in the crock pot as long as possible--this really needs to be served warm in my opinion.  I boiled chicken breasts instead of using canned chicken, which works very well.  Bf shredded the chicken for me.  Thanks for the recipe!

text:
I gave this recipe 4 stars only because of the canned chicken. Everything about meat in a can does not sit well. :(  I boiled 2 pounds of chicken breast (cut into strips to boil)  I only used 1/2 cup fat free ranch (may use a little less next time), fat free cream cheese (with the other ingredients you can't tell the difference) and almost a whole cup of Texas Pete Chicken Wing Barbecue sauce.  I do bake it for 20 in the oven and then transger to a crock pot on warm for serving.  I served with tortilla chips and celery.  What a tasty treat at my football parties!  Heats up well the next day the next day too!  THANK YOU for the recipe!!  So much better and easier than wings!!

city:

region:

country:
None
text:
i made this tonight for my husband to snack on while the football game was on (and to do a test run for a possible baby shower dip)... it was good! used a shredded rotissery chicken (canned chicken is too disgusting to even eat in my opinion) & i layered the ingredients rather than mixing them all together like some people suggested to make it 'look better' however, i thought that by layering everything there were some bites that tasted like nothing but cream cheese and ranch, and others that were just chicken and hot sauce. i'll mix it all together next time i make it. we use enough hot sauce in this that the color of the dip when mixed wont look like a pastel orange, it will be more true to the color of the actual hot sauce (not that it really matters). i liked dipping this with celery and french bread, my husband liked using ranch flavored dorritos. next time i make this i'll try it with bagel crisps and fritos!

text:
I am always asked to bring this dip to the party- it is a huge hit. I layered it like others suggested, so I mix the cream cheese with half ranch and half blue cheese. Then I top with the chicken / sauce mixture and bake it. I use Franks Buffalo Sauce instead of the Red Hot, and I also use a rotisseree chicken or pre cooked chicken- never canned. I also omit the cheese, I don't think it's needed. I serve with blue corn chips and celery. Delicious!!

text:
Easy and Delicious!  I substitute cooked chicken breast for the canned chicken and use blue cheese dressing instead of ranch.  I put all ingredients in my Pampered Chef 2 quart mixing bowl and microwave for about 2 minutes (until everything is melted) stirring half way between and then transfer everything to my crock pot. Serve with crackers, corn chips or celery and carrots.  It's always a hit and always gone fast!!!

country:
None
text:
When I make this my friends and family cannot stop eating it until it's gone...I did however change a little about the recipe! First I boil 3-4 boneless chicken breast, then shred. While chicken is boiling I cut up 2 8oz blocks of cream cheese in crock pot to heat and soften up. Add the chicken then mix in a whole medium size bottle of Franks Red Hot and a large bottle of Hidden Valley Ranch drsg. After that I added about a bag of shredded cheddar cheese. Mix frequently or the sides burn. Eat w/ tortilla scoops to hold the chicken...you'll run out of chips and dip!

country:
None
text:
This was a good recipe but to be honest the chedder cheese just sounded weird to me so I came up with this alernative recipe.  1 lb chicken, cooked and shredded, 8oz cream cheese, 1/2 cup ranch dressing, 5oz crumbled blue cheese, Tabasco sauce to taste (about 1/4 cup).  Place cream cheese, hot sauce and ranch dressing in a sauce pan and cook over medium heat until cream cheese is melted, stirring to combine. Taste and add more tabasco if desired. Mix in blue cheese and chicken.  Transfer to baking dish and bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes.

text:
We are snacking on this right now.  This is definitely man food as my teenage son loves it and my husband keeps going back for more too.  I have to say that it does taste like buffalo chicken but it's leaving a sort of greasy feel in my mouth that I don't like.  I used block cheese as recommended by the top rated review but still had to blot the dip with paper towels when it came out of the oven to reduce the oiliness on top.  Instead of using the slow cooker, I mixed everything together as instructed and baked it in an 8x8 pan for about 20 min. at 350*.  Served with Sociables crackers and celery.  If I make this again for the guys, I will cut the recipe in half but still bake it in the 8x8 pan so that, as my husband just said, there will be "cheese in every bite."

text:
Yum!  Sooo good!  Tastes just like a chicken wing and perfect on a celery stick!  I did modify, however, using traditional Buffalo wing ingredients: I used shredded chicken thigh meat, 1/3 less fat cream cheese, Bob's bleu cheese dressing (instead of ranch), Frank's Buffalo Wing Sauce and omitted the cheddar cheese.  I topped it with a few more dashes of wing sauce and sprinkled bleu cheese crumbles over that to make it look nice.  I agree the color is not the most appetizing, but if you love Buffalo wings like I do, you won't care.

country:
None
text:
I absolutely LOVE this recipe!  I have made it for a few years, and always get a ton of compliments.  Yes, the canned chicken doesn't have the most pleasant smell when you open it, but it's wonderful in this dip.  Also, I would definitely stick with the ranch dressing, as the recipe states.  Blue cheese might be great for dipping wings in, but it's no wonder some people don't eat it after people substitute it--I'm not a fan of blue cheese, and would not try it in the dip.  If you want a perfect dip, make it the exact way it is stated.  Also, the chicken flavored crackers (i.e., Chicken in a Biscuit) is the best way to eat this dip--it rounds out the flavors.  I would also recommend Hidden Valley for the ranch dressing--I used Kraft one time, and it did not have the same yummy results.

text:
I typically cook this recipe from start to finish on the stovetop, skipping the slow cooker step. I turn the heat to low, add the rest of the cheese, and stir the mixture until the cheese has completely melted. The finished product is easily transfered to a serving dish. I serve this dip with tortilla chips in lieu of the suggested crackers and use 1 cup of pepper sauce (instead of the 3/4 cup suggested) to add a little more spice. Absolutely everyone who tastes this dip asks me for the recipe. Summer, Winter, Spring or Fall, this dip is a HIT!

text:
This recipe kicks some serious butt! It's great football food (I actually just whipped up a batch while watching the NFC Champ game) I do make some minor adjustments: I use diced chicken that i cook myself instead of canned. This time I actually had left over turkey so i used that and you can barely tell the difference. Also, I use a pre-made buffalo sauce and only a couple splashes of Frank's. I love that recipe has familiar flavors and presents them in a new fun way. Also this is great for parties since eating regular wings is a messy affair this really cuts down on the dirty finger and all those bones. I highly reccomend this for super bowl!!

text:
Fabulous dip! Easy to do! I followed a few reviewers suggestions and used skinless, boneless chicken breasts in place of the canned chicken. Just simmered them for 15 to 20 minutes till cooked through, then chopped them up into very tiny pieces. Also added a 1/2 stick butter as another suggested. I made my ranch dressing using Hidden Valley Ranch dressing mix and followed the pkg directions. It is very spicy but buffalo wings are suppose to be very spicy so it lives up to expectations. This excellent dip has been added to my standard recipes

text:
My family make this dip all of the time.  My nieces have renamed it BCD.  We use a whole cup of hot sauce and a cup of blue cheese dressing.  We also use boneless, skinless chicken breast that we cook and chop.  Much better than canned.  We don't put the cheddar cheese on top, because we always serve it in a crock pot and the cheese on top isn't necessary.  We serve with Frito Scoops along with the celery. Great dip!  We crave it and usually make a double batch.

text:
My famiy and friends like buffalo to be really hot.  I modified the recipe to reflect this.  I now put 1 1/2 bottles of the hot sauce in it while cooking the chicken.  This has resulted in a lot hotter dip for our taste.  The original recipe is also good... but if you like it hot I recommend putting more in to suit your taste.  It will come out wonderfully!!!

I never have any leftovers when I make this and I always double the batch.  It's great!

This was awesome! I didn't use canned chicken though, since I don't really like it. I boiled a couple of boneless, skinless chicken breasts in chicken broth instead. I was even thinking that using frozen breaded chicken fingers would work, too. Just chop them up and mix them with the sauce. Awesome recipe!

text:
Great recipe for tailgating! I used three large boneless, skinless breasts which I boiled, cooled, then threw in a food processor. This fine consistency was great for a dip. I also used twice as much Texas Pete buffalo wing sauce. (Okay, this was a little much, and next time I'll probably use 1 cup. 3/4 c. seemed insufficient, but 1.5 c. was a little strong.) I also warmed the dip in casserole dish in the oven. I will make this for the guys again, but will leave off the cheese topping, and maybe omit it altogether. You cannot taste the cheese, and I'm not sure what this even adds to the recipe. Anyway, what does cheddar cheese have to do w/ the taste of buffalo wings? All in all, this dip was a hit, and the recipe yields enough to feed a large group of strapping young men and then some.

text:
This is by far the biggest hit I've ever made.  I did make it as a layer dip - used ranch dressing and softened cream cheese (blended) as the first layer, boiled (with grill seasoning and onion powder)shredded chicken smothered in Frank's Buffalo sauce as the second layer, topped off with shredded cheddar and baked at 350 for about 20ish minutes.  Fabulous served with Frito's scoops and celery sticks.

I make this all the time. Even in smaller batches just to have as a snack for myself when watching TV.

Very good recipe-once I experimented.  i followed the advice of some other members to layer it for a nicer appearance and found it too hot that way.  All you could taste was the hot sauce and heat!!!  Also, I took this to a cookout and the cheese on top became hard sitting out.  I ended up mixing the leftovers together and microwaving that.  Much much better!!  Spciy, but not over the top-the flavors had a chance to melt together making a much more palatable dip.  Will make again!

text:
This dip is a hit at any kind of sports party! I have gone through a lot of trial and error with this recipe though:  The first time I made it I layered it and baked it in pan.  It cooled off too fast and made one big clump.  The second time I put it in the slow cooker and it became really greasy and separated.  Now I keep it in the slow cooker, but I use the Velveeta shreds.  They melt great and don't get all greasy like reg. cheddar cheese does.  I also use cut up rotisserie chicken, and add crumbled blue cheese.  The hubby loves it with the Chicken In a Biscuit crackers.

city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
The cheddar cheese makes this extremely oily. I have tried many different combos and have found that Maries Bleu Cheese dressing, Franks Buffalo Wing Sauce and mozzarella instead of cheddar is best (waaaaay less greasy). When I used the canned chicken, it had a tendency to get "lost" so I have started to use fresh chicken that I boil/bake and the shred. If taking to a party, I will put in a crock pot (layering w/ cream cheese on very bottom, then chicken, hot sauce, mozzarella and finally dressing). The chicken wing dip idea is great, but I had to play around with this quite a bit.

text:
I've made this loads of times, and people scrape the bottom.  First of all, I use bleu cheese dressing.  Secondly, I chop up celery (about a cup) and mix that into the dip.  I've served it in a small crock pot...the celery will lose some of its crunch this way after a long time of cooking in there, but still adds something.  It adds crunch and a little lightness (and makes more dip!) Lastly, I serve it with crackers AND celery sticks.  The celery is my favorite way to dip it because it's lower guilt and just tastier than crackers.

text:
This was one of the best recipes to come from this site. I made the following changes per other reviews: I used a pound of ground turkey instead of the canned chicken, and browned it before addig Franks Wing sauce.....Half a bottle was perfect. I also substituted blue cheese dressing for the ranch, and I think it halped make this spectacular. I layered this dip with the cream cheese on the bottom, and put the grond turkey on top, with a sparse amount of cheese on top. I served this right out of the oven and served it on a warming tray to keep it the right temperature. Placing tortilla chips on the side in an oven-safe bowl made for the perfect touch....Thanks so much for posting this recipe!!

country:
None
text:
I love this recipe. I've brought it to a few functions and it's gobbled up. Here are my changes though. For a single batch, I use 2 boneless, skinless chicken breasts & bake them with some salt & pepper in the oven. Then I cut them into a few pieces each and toss them into my food processor. That way when you mix the chicken with the cream cheese & rance it's more of a consistent texture. Also I only use about 1/2 cup of Frank's & serve it with Tostitos scoops.

text:
5 STARS~THIS WAY! I recently had a similiar dip that was combined like this one. Let me just say it is much better layered with the cream cheese/ranch at the bottom, then the chicken/Franks Red Hot next, and just a light layer of shredded cheese. Heat until just bubbly. I don't care for the greasy effect when all the cheese is added and combined. It really is a delicious recipe!

country:

text:
This had great flavor.  I only had 1/2 cup of red hot left so that's all I used.  The only thing that I didn't like was that it HAS to stay hot.  If the dip cools it gets very thick.  If people take small portions at a time out of the crock pot it's better.  I don't think I would like this at all baked in the oven then cooling during serving.  

I made this again.  This time used 2 large chicken breasts that I shreaded, one package of cream cheese, 1/2 cup hot sauce (so the kids would still eat it) and 1 cup of blue cheese dressing.  It was great.  Didn't get as thick as the first time great flavor.  Will be making this again and again.

Next time I'll add another chicken breast. Family ate it up on Football Sunday. Tasted just like wings! Served it with Fritos and celery. WILL be making this again soon!

text:
This is a great recipe!  Everyone loves it with the Fritos Scoops.  I took the other rater's suggestion and used Blue Cheese dressing instead of Ranch, which gave it more of an authentic Buffalo Wing taste.  You also have to definitely use either Frank's Hot sauce or Trappy's Red Devil.  Any other hot sauce just doesn't make the original Buffalo Wing taste.  I also threw in cooked grilled chicken along with the can chicken to give it more texture and threw it all into a crock pot to keep warm during any party I take this too.  Believe me, it doesn't last long because it is addictive.

text:
Big hit at party and easy to make. I used. Like other reviewers, I used real chicken (boiled 3 breasts for 20 mins, then shred), and mixed with franks hot wing sauce. I layered this over the mixture of blue cheese dressing and 1/3 less fat cream cheese in small 1 1/2 quart casserole dish and then baked in the oven for 25 minutes. Doesn't need cheddar cheese. Looks nicer than mixing all together in crock pot. Served with celery and scoops.

city:

region:

country:
None
text:
I made this recipe for the Bears/Saints playoff game.  Since the Bears won, I attribute this awesome dip to their success and will be making again this weekend for the Superbowl!  

The dip did have a strange orange color as noted from another reviewer, but that did not prevent everyone from gobbling this up! Rather than using canned chicken, I bought a ready-to-go rotisserie chicken from the grocery store and shredded the chicken breasts to use in the dish.  I chose the lightly seasoned rotisserie chicken, which enhanced the flavor of the dip. I saved the other pieces for dinner later in the week. I served the dip with clubhouse sticks crackers as well as bite-sized celery sticks. Some of my guests were dipping pretzels in too.   

Overall, a fantastic taste that is so close to the real wing taste without the mess!

text:
Ugly, but tasty.  Loved using celery sticks instead of crackers.  Addictive. UPDATE 9/18/07: I was missing the celery taste if I used crackers so I sprinkled celery seeds (found in the spice rack at grocery store) over top before backing.  Oh, and now I mix the cream cheese and blue cheese together, "frost" the pan, then mix the chicken and "Franks" hot sauce together and spread over top... then sprinkle with the celery seeds and bake.  So much more appetizing to the eye.

text:
I made this dip for a party and everyone loved it!  However I did make a few changes.  I used fresh chicken breasts which I partially froze, and then pulsed in a food processor.  I sauteed them in some pam and let cool.  I then mixed all ingredients together, omitting the cheese, and baked in a 350 oven for 20 minutes. I added 1 cup of cheddar on top and popped back in the oven for 5 more minutes.  I was worried that the dip would get cold, but it didn't have time.  It was gone in the first 10 minutes! Thanks for sharing the awesome recipe!

I have been wanting to try this, so finally TODAY was the day!  HT had chicken on sale and off I went. I chopped up fresh cooked chicken, then added 1 cup Frank's Hot wing sauce. I baked in the oven for 10 minutes at 350, then added the other ingrediants. I used the ranch dressing, lite cream cheese, and a mexican blend cheese. I believe by baking the Frank's sauce and the chicken first, it did not seperate as so many reviewers had a problem with. Bets with celery because it has a kick to it! Fritos and Tostitos are also good with it.

text:
I took the advise of other reviewers.  I boiled and shredded chicken breasts, used blue cheese, ommitted the cheddar cheese, and used Frank's buffalo wing sauce.  I also didn't pay attention to the measurements.  I just kept adding ingredients until I got the taste and consistency I wanted.  I have made it twice.  First time I started it on the stove and then put it in a baking dish and baked for a few minutes before serving.  Second time I cooked it on the stove and then took it to work in a crock pot and heated it up.  It was extremely greasy.  I wil definitely make it again, because everyone loved it, but will only make it when I can put it in the oven.  I would not recommend using a crock pot.

text:
Unbelievable!  This dip was absolutely amazing! I served it last night at a large jewelry party (like a Tupperware kind of thing).  OMG, everyone went nuts over it! Today, I have to either email it or print it out for people who requested it!  I did make a couple of minor changes...1) Poached & shredded two boneless chicken breast halves, 2) Neufchatel low-fat cream cheese 3) Reduced Fat Bleu Cheese dressing instead of Ranch 4) Reduced Fat shredded Cheddar cheese 5) I baked it at 300 degrees in a stoneware casserole dish for about 40 mins. instead of the slow cooker.  Honestly, I had dreams of this dish all night!  I can't wait to make it again!  Thanks!

country:

text:
I was looking for an appetizer recipe for a potluck that would use up some extra grilled chicken breasts I had on hand. I found this one and decided to give it a try. Even though I wasn't sure I would like it, I thought that those who like spicy food probably would. I have to say I was even more skeptical after I put it together, it can look pretty unappetizing. When it was hot and standing, some oil (from the cheese?) floated to the top, and when it cooled it looked kind of curdled. That said, everyone at the potluck LOVED it. I used blue cheese rather than ranch dressing and Frank's Red Hot Sauce and everyone was saying "this tastes just like Buffalo wings". Most people seemed to like it with the crackers (I tried the new Ritz Sticks) instead of the celery. Once it has cooled a little it is a lot easier to dip up. The only thing I would do differently is not chop my chicken quite as finely. I also didn't think it was "too" hot. Definitely spicy but it didn't leave your lips burning. I think I would like to try this again and use ranch dressing to see how it tastes because I thought the blue cheese flavor made it taste kind of sour.

text:
I used fresh chicken with this recipe, only half the cream cheese and the full amount of the hot sauce. I didn't bother with the stove top melting process. I simply threw everything (except the chicken) into the food processor, placed in a casserole dish and baked. Once hot I put the dish under the broiler for a minute or two. Hubby and kids eat hot wings at least four times a month, so I knew they'd love this dip. We thought it was great and I can't wait to serve this at my next party. Good job NunPunch!

text:
I love this dip.  It is so easy and folks love it.  I normally double it up and freeze some for another day.  

I use Sweet Baby Ray's Buffalo Wing sauce, which keeps the acidity down.  Folks who say they usually don't like Buffalo Chicken Dip, because it is too acidic love my version and now make this recipe with Little Baby Ray's for their own gatherings.  That said, my family is big on spicy foods and they love it with Baby Ray's, too.

text:
We have been making buffalo chicken dip for years, but not in the crockpot so I thought I would give this recipe a try.  Canned meat was not even an option so I boiled and shredded my chicken breast and let it marinate in franks for a bit.  I already knew two bars of cream cheese was too much so I did 1 & 1/2 bars.  I wish I would have put in less ranch as well because I ended up having to add a ridiculous amount of franks to kill the overwhelming ranch flavor.  I used the casserole style crockpot and it worked out great.  So yes, this was good, but not as its written.

Display Name:
Kimberly Crowe

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/4133870.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
Great recipe but made a few tweaks.

1. I used fresh chicken breast tenderloins that I boiled and then shredded. After I shredded it I added it to a pan with some butter.

2. Got a block of cheddar cheese that I shredded instead of using the prepackaged shredded cheese. Only used about a half cup.

3. Instead of using ranch dressing I used 1/2 cup of ranch and 1/2 cup of blue cheese and then a squirt of each because it was a little too spicy.

4. Would have used a little less of the Frank's Red Hot because my boyfriend thought it was a little too spicy.

Turned out delicious! Will definitely be making this again! Just wish I had made a little more because it's disappearing too quickly in my house! Even my picky teenage son thinks it's delicious.
Review:
Rating:
5
dateLastModified:
2019-10-21T01:29:22.257

text:
I made this for a party I attended and it was a big hit. I did substitute the canned chicken with a whole rotisserie chicken (shredded) and put all of the cheese this recipe called for in the actual dip and sprinkled more on top after I transferred the mixture to the crock pot. Also, when I was prepping it I softened the cream cheese (almost melted) and mixed in the ranch and cheddar cheese before adding it to the chicken/hot sauce mixture. Definitely worth making!

text:
This dip is sure to satisfy any crowd, truly any gathering of people will devour this in record time. I'm making a batch for a 4th of July party today because it's been so popular at the other events.  I follow directions except I cook my frozen chicken breasts in the crock pot with taco seasoning and a packet of dry ranch dressing, shred it and then proceed with recipe. Works like a charm. I do use the Franks too. Some reviews have commented on the coloring being oddly orange and unappealing. I did not encounter this at all.  It's a winner.

text:
This dip has become a staple in our house.  It's just delicious. I love using the crock pot.  I use 1 package chicken breast, coat in Franks' red hot wing sauce, and cook on low about 4 hours until done.  Take out chicken, shred, and return to sauce.  I love the original recipe, but my husband finds it to creamy.  For him, I decrease to 4 oz cream cheese, 3/4 cup shredded cheddar cheese, & 1 tablespoon ranch dressing mix.   Still delicious, but more chicken than sauce.

region:

country:
None
text:
I've been making this recipe for years after a co-worker brought it to work for a potluck lunch.  The only thing I do differently, is to heat everything through in a large saucepan on the stove, then either put it in a casserole dish on a hotplate, or put it in a slow cooker to keep it warm.  This recipe has been a go-to appetizer for parties and I've even made it for supper when we don't want a big "meat and potatoes" dinner.  I serve it with the "F" brand scoops corn chip or tortilla chips rather than crackers.  It's always a hit!!

This was my first time making this and it was a huge hit at our back yard bbq.  It was super easy to make.  I read the other reviews and poached 3 chicken breasts instead of using canned chicken (great idea!).  I used old cheddar cheese and there was some grease while cooking in the oven but I just removed it.  Only thing I would do differently is maybe half the recipe as it was a bit too much.  I will definitely make this again.

text:
Love this dip! I always make it in the crock pot. I boil the chicken for 20 minutes (or until cooked). Then, shred the chicken. Next, add all of the ingredients to the crock pot and cook for about 30 minutes (or until everything is melted). Also, I only use 1/2 cup of hot sauce because it can be too spicy for some people. Serve with Tostitos chips.

text:
This is an amazing recipe that has become a staple at parties. I have made this recipe with ranch and blue cheese. Both work fine, really comes down to preference. I am partial to the traditional pairing of blue cheese with Buffalo wings. The one change to this recipe that I highly recommend is using actual boneless skinless chicken breast. Boil it, let it sit for 10 minutes, then pop it in the KA mixer if you have one and it will mince to the PERFECT consistency. Enjoy!

text:
Super easy, fool proof and versatile.  I modified to what I had on hand...I used 3 canned chicken ( we like chunkier ) Used only one 1/3 less fat  cream cheese block. but 3/4 cup ricotta cheese ( leftover from making lasagna last night ), 2 TBSP Allouette chive cheese( another leftover item). and a small bottle ( 5oz) of Frank's red hot sauce, a small handful of fresh grated parmesan cheese ( you guessed it, leftover item). topped with a sliced muenster cheese torn up in pieces. Microwaved until bubbly. Ha ! it tasted like any other buffalo dip I've had, and I am happy I've used up some leftover the goods in the fridge ! Like I said, VERY FOOLPROOF !

userID:
12875934
Display Name:
corinthlove
isPro:
False
followersCount:
0
followingCount:
0
madeRecipesCount:
5
favoritesCount:

recipesCount:

reviewsCount:
0
photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/5614254.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
I made some simple changes to this recipe. I parboiled 2 chicken breasts and shredded them instead of using canned chicken. I mixed the shredded chicken with Franks Red Hot Wing Sauce and let it sit in a bowl while preparing the other ingredients. I mixed the softened cream cheese with 1cup blue cheese dressing instead of ranch. I also did not used all the shredded cheddar this recipe calls for. I used about 3/4 cup of shredded cheddar cheese and mixed it into the cream cheese mixture. After in was sufficiently incorporated, I added in the shredded chicken. I mixed this all together and placed it in a 13x9 baking pan. I topped it with a sprinkle of shredded cheddar cheese & baked it at 350 until it was bubbling around the edges. I served it with tortilla scoops. It was a hit at our Christmas Eve party & I will be making it again!

https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/2612439.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
This recipe certainly deserves 5 stars. It's a good base for a simple and easy dip but I also made some changes after reading the reviews and was very happy with the results. I used 3 cups of shredded chicken I made in a slowcooker just seasoned with salt and pepper. After that, I just threw all the ingredients straight into a slowcooker on low for a few hours. I also used blue cheese dressing instead of ranch, and probably an entire cup (and a splash extra) of Frank's red hot because I like it hot. Turned out great! Not the prettiest dip I've ever made but super yummy. I think it's also good left over and the longer it sits the longer the flavors come together.

text:
Great Party Dip,  After a few times of making this dip, I made some adjustments.  I use Franks Red Hot Buffalo Sauce vs the pepper sauce (it makes a huge difference) Instead of 1 cup of ranch, I use 1/2 cup of ranch & 1/2 cup of Blue Cheese dressing and if I am not pressed for time, I use real shredded chicken.  I feel like the buffalo sauce really gives it that wing flavor that I think the pepper sauce lacks! Otherwise this dip is definitely a HUGE hit whenever I make it!

text:
As written this recipe is not very good, rather than give a bad review, I made it a different way the 2nd time. First i used rotisserie chicken, canned chicken is not good nor ideal for this dip. I halved the cream cheese, used frank's hot sauce and did not mix in the ranch dressing, we spooned it on top of the dip. Those who got oily or greasy results, what kind of cheese did you use? Cheap or store brand cheese is mostly oil and when melted makes everything oily.  Good the 2nd time around, next time i will boil and shred chicken breasts and incorporate some green onions.

This is my go to. It was the rave of everyone in the office last year. One piece of advice. Do not use sargento cheddar cheese. Wow. It was bogo a few months ago, so I bought it. There were red oil deposits all through the dip. Tried stirring, reheating and stirring. Lol. It was gross and no one in my house would eat it. Stick to Kraft or the store brands.

text:
I LOVE this dip! it's my absolute favorite. I have started tweaking it a little, but only by doing half the called for ranch, and then using bleu cheese for the other half. gives it a little extra tang. I make it all in a pot on the stove and let it simmer for about 10 minutes after everything is mixed together rather than putting it in the crock pot. less dishes, and ready in like 20 minutes. I converted a non-buffalo person to loving it because of this dip. Not hot by any means, just the perfect amount of heat. I can eat it non-stop and no issues. Delicious!

text:
I have made this dip different ways, but I normally make it with canned chicken (Tyson premium white chicken). I definitely want to make it with rotisserie chicken or boiled chicken to see if there is a big difference or not. I made some recently with ranch seasoning where you mix it with mayo and milk and loved the results... Tasted better than just regular ranch dressing. Also, warming the cream cheese, Frank's hot sauce (buffalo style) and ranch dressing together then mixing it with the chicken is a must before baking it. How hot you make it depends on what crowd your making it for!

country:
None
text:
This is a very good dip.  However, it needs adjustments, for sure.  Add more chicken.  I used a rotisserie chicken because I don't like canned chicken.  You only need one thing of cream cheese, and I used reduced fat.  Reduce the amount of cheddar cheese to a half cup.  Reduce the amount of ranch dressing by half.  You may need to add some more hot sauce (I used Franks wing sauce and it was delicious but really not that spicy).  I also added green onions, and loved the flavor they added.  I'm going to make this for every party I attend...it was that good. But I'd never make it per the recipe.

The first time I made this, I made it exactly as specified in the recipe. It was good, but the hot sauce had an afterbite I didn't enjoy, and it was a little too tangy for my taste. The second time I made it I used Cholula hot sauce, which was much smoother without losing any of its fire, and I reduced the Ranch dressing by about 25%. The result was perfect, smooth and creamy and delicious.

country:
None
text:
I added my own spin to the recipe. I used a pound of boneless skinless chicken cubed. I seasoned the chicken with sazon and cayenne pepper, then marinated it in franks red hot in a ziplock bag in the fridge for  about a hour.I made the chicken in a frying pan with some oil, drained  out the extra stuff and added the creme cheese, ranch and some  cheese (american, hot pepper and mozzarella).  You have to play around with the hot sauce to find the right amount, I used alot. I then put it in the crock pot on low. Awesome!

I like that the ingredients are "cooked" together first as it allows the cream cheese to blend together instead of dumping it all into a crockpot and having chunks of cream cheese.  I would agree with other reviewers about the extra cheese--it does look rather oily. I just stir it in the crock pot a few times before serving, but you could probably use freshly shredded cheese or omit it altogether.

userID:

Display Name:
Chef Marlyce

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/5677174.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
I made this with a couple changes. First, I had a bit of bacon I wanted to use up, so I made bacon bits in a skillet, then put them aside and started the chicken and hot sauce in the bacon drippings. I also wanted a dip that I could make ahead, and then reheat at service time. So I cooled the mix first, and spread all of the grated cheese on top. Then for a top layer (and a bit of sweet to compliment the spicy) I made a zig-zag pattern of ketchup on top. After I reheated it, I sprinkled the bacon bits and some green onions on top :) I will definitely make it again. Love the simplicity, and the how friendly this recipe is when you want to change it up! Next time I think I will try a sprinkle of red peppers sliced olives on top...

text:
Excellent recipe and dip. I experimented with various dipping materials, and settled on California Sourdough (sliced). I further cut each slice into squares or rectangles (roughly, except along curved edges), so that it would be easy for guests to put small amounts of dip onto them for snacking. The bread was not hard, but it was firm enough to hold the dip. It made for a nice taste combination. Definitely a winner!

text:
I like this recipe for a base start and have made it according to instructions and varied it some. It best with the following adjustments:

Swap ranch for a good bleu cheese dressing (I get a soup cup from a local restaurant that is outstanding and worth it)! 

Swap the canned chicken for 2 large chicken breasts or 3 smaller ones. Steam them in a pan with water and then pull apart with fingers once cooled.

Add 2 Tbsp of Kerry Gold butter to the shredded chicken and sauce...just enough to bring it all together.

Lastly, mix the bleu cheese and cream cheese together and spread evenly on the bottom of a baking dish, layer the chicken mixture on top of that, and finally the shredded cheese.

Heat the oven to 400 and bake to let all of the ingredients heat through (15 minutes). 

We like this best with a good tortilla chip and celery sticks for dipping...YUM!!!
Review:
Rating:
5
dateLastModified:
2015-11-25T05:06:54.673
helpfulCount:
0

text:
Love this recipe, but DO NOT USE CANNED CHICKEN! Trust me, try it with real chicken, the results are so much better. For the best flavor, I don't think Frank's Red Hot can be beat as far as hot sauce in this. We have made it without the shredded cheese, and to me there's no measurable difference in flavor, and you save a little bit of fat. So good!

Love this recipe with the blue cheese dressing & real chicken.  I use my pressure cooker for everything, especially when I have to shred.  I cooked 4 whole chicken breasts for 20 min at 15psi, let the pressure go down, opened it, & stirred.  It literally fell apart.  I also used the broth in the pressure cooker, to keep it moist since I put it all in a slow cooker to keep it warm. Adding butter is even yummier, but it adds to the cholesterol.

text:
Fantastic recipe! However I made a few changes: I didn't use canned chicken (ew), instead I boiled some chicken breasts (about 1.50 pounds of chicken, then shredded it), I grated my own sharp cheddar cheese off the block (Ive read from other comments that using pre-packaged shredded cheese makes it more oily), and I used 1 full cup of hot sauce instead of 3/4 of a cup. I highly recommend modifying this recipe with these changes. Enjoy!

I would have given the recipe 5 stars, but I did have to make one change to make the dip have the zing I was looking for. I had to add a bit more hot sauce than what was stated (I'd guess it to be a whole cup vs the 3/4c) when I tasted the dip before baking it, it was very light and cream cheesy. It was still good, but I was looking for more of that buffalo zing. I also added a light dusting of cilantro for a garnished look. Great recipe none the less!

text:
I made this recipe on a whim to supplement a casual weekend lunch.  I used President's Choice (a Canadian brand) Buffalo Wing Sauce, and added a lot more than called for simply because I love the flavour.  As with many reviewers, I used fresh chicken, and basically stir fried it in vegetable oil until it was cooked, and then added the wing sauce.  Also, in the interest of not having to clean another dish, I added all of the cheddar cheese right into the mixture and didn't bother to heat in the slow cooker or oven.  It turned out great nevertheless!

text:
This was the simplest and best buffalo chicken dip I have ever had. I used fresh chicken breast which I boiled and shredded and then sauteed in the hot sauce just long enough to coat. I used extra franks buffalo wing sauce and by extra I mean an entire medium sized bottle and after cooking the chicken in the hot sauce I mixed it all in a bowl with about a cup of Monterrey Jack cheese and tossed it in the crock pot for a few hours until hot and bubbly. It turned out awesome and I had no issues with it separating. I do think it would be good without any added cheese but the Monterrey Jack cheese was an awesome addition. Thanks for a simple and great recipe!

This was good. I don't do canned chicken so I cooked two breasts and chopped it myself. I used carrot slices and it worked great.

Display Name:
Bellasdad

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/5674130.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
Awesome Recipe!!! I make this dip for almost every event we have.  There are never any leftovers to bring home. What I do differently is to exclude the crock-pot and to exclude the internal cheese. I move mine from the stove top to a glass 9X13 baking dish, which gives it around a perfect 1/2" layer for dipping. I then top the dip with a thin layer of the shredded cheddar cheese. You only want a thin layer of cheese or else it will be to hard for the crackers to dip through once it cools. From there I cover it with foil and put it in a 375 oven just until the cheese is melted. This dip is best when served warm but is also great when cooled down throughout the night during a party. Don't be afraid to use the canned chicken, No one can tell with the other ingredients. Also any brand of Buffalo wing sauce will work. This dip has the perfect buffalo wing taste without the heat.
Review:
Rating:
5

text:
Great Recipe!  I prefer to not use canned chicken though.  I typically use Curly's shredded chicken.  I serve with tortilla chips and garden veggie crackers.  I love it with the crackers!  For this holiday season ill be making this and trying something different.  I'm going to use fresh boneless skinless chicken breast and put in crock pot with the hot sauce to cook for about 8 hours.  Then I'll shred it, mix in the rest of the ingredients them out back I'm the crock pot.  This dip does really well in the crock pot and is why I always cook it in.  Keeps it warm for parties and easy to transport!

text:
I boiled a chicken and used 20 oz of the meat from that. Just pulled the chicken off the bones and cut up with scissors.  I also used my homemade ranch dressing.  I just mixed everything together (except half the cheddar) and then topped with remaining cheddar.  I didn't even fool with the crock pot.  Cooked it all in an iron skillet.  When I topped it with the cheddar I stick it in the microwave for about a minute to melt the cheese.  Serve with Ritz crackers, baguettes or tortilla chips.

text:
This is basically the only dish I am allowed to bring to parties now. I don't use the crock pot unless it's going to be sitting out for a while. A quick zap in the microwave will also do the trick if you're eating it right away and it's cooled off from cooking. 

I used 1/2 cup of Buffalo Ranch and a 1/2 cup Buffalo Blue Cheese (Wishbone) for salad dressing.I also put all the cheese in and let it melt. Very easy to make. Just double check that all the cream cheese is melted before serving.

text:
The guys really love this recipe so I make it quite often. I leave out the grated cheese because I do not like the fact it gets so hard once cold and I dislike having to keep warming it up. The guys also like it better without the cheese. We are cheese eaters so it's not that we dislike the taste the cheese gives it's more the texture when cold that we dislike. For us it's so much better and perfect without the cheese. Thanks so much for a great recipe!

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/5674168.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
Great recipe.  Its not quite the same as eating real buffalo wings but its a very good substitute.  Its a little cheaper to make and goes further at a large party as opposed to buying a 50 piece bucket of wings.  The only thing different I do with the dip recipe is that instead of using 3/4 cup (6 oz) of hot sauce, I buy one 5 oz bottle of Frank's Red Hot, and just add the whole bottle.  This way, there's no measuring, I just open the bottle and dump it in.  Besides, I love love it on the hotter side but some of my friends & family do not.  Using one whole 5 oz bottle seems to give the perfect amount of of heat, with enough hot sauce to give it a little kick and add good flavor but not too hot for people who don't like overly spicy food.  I think the dip is better served with Tortilla chips than crackers.

This was perfect, and so easy!  It had just the right amount of flavor, and not too much heat. I thought the canned chicken was just fine, despite the comments by other reviewers.

text:
My coworker makes this for every potluck and the entire office loves it. Everyone is always asking her ahead of time if she's making it and it's the first thing to go when it comes time to eat. I had some leftover canned chicken so I decided to make it today. I made the recipe exactly how you see it here, except I cooked at 20 minutes on 325 in a glass dish instead of using the slow cooker.  I even used all off brand ingredients, and it was delicious!  I used brand name Frank's Red Hot though... can't skimp on that! No doubt this would be even better with fresh chicken... but it's pretty perfect as is! Oh, and don't cut out the cheddar cheese... it adds a certain depth and dimension to the flavor, especially if you use sharp!

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/5614248.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
Excellent! I've been making this recipe for 4 years now for various get-togethers and it always receives rave reviews! I do add a bit of habanero pepper sauce (2 tbsp) to give it that extra kick. And I have made the recipe lighter using low-fat cream cheese, lite ranch dressing, and reduced-fat cheese...it's nearly as good as the full fat recipe.

I always mix everything on the stovetop and then transfer to a crockpot to keep warm throughout the party. I also prefer the dip with regular or baked tortilla chips. Delicious! Thanks!

text:
I make this slightly different. In bottom of baking dish spread cream cheese, using whole chix breast (2) shread after cooking and mix with hot sauce and 6 tbls melted butter. Layer over cr. cheese. Next cover with a thin layer of ranch dressing and top with shredded cheese of your choice. Bake at 350 until cheese is melted. Everyone loves this and I never leave without being asked the recipe.

This was SO good! I used the Frank's Red Hot Buffalo sauce wich is a little more tangy than regular hot sauce. Instead of canned chicken, I used one of those roasted/rotisserie chickens they sell at many grocery stores these days. Rather than using the slow cooker, and because we needed to transport the finished product to the party, I placed in a oven-safe dish and heated on 250. Everyone loved it!
