text:
we love this dip, it has become a staple in our house.  We changed up the recipe a bit cuz my husband doesn't like cream cheese that much.  We only use one package of cream cheese, 1 cup of buffalo sauce like Franks Buffalo Wing sauce  The more buffalo sauce gives it more of a kick and we use 3 to 4 chicken breasts that we chop up and cook in a pan then put into a food processor.  It doesn't get that canned chicken taste and we found to be less expensive.

text:
I have been making a version of this recipe for many years, except I use 2-3 fresh chicken breasts, cook it and dice it small, then add 1 cup of frank's and warm a couple of minutes.  Then I add 2 pkgs of cream cheese, 1 cup blue cheese dressing (not the light stuff...), and a handful of shredded cheddar, or better yet, the pre-shredded mexi style cheese that has jalepenos and chili powder in it.  I serve it with tortilla chips, the low salt kind, but I like the suggestion of celery...I think I'll try that next time!!!

This is the best! I wish I could give it more stars. The recipe posted is fantastic. However I have made a few changes to meet my needs lol. I add some cayenne pepper for more kick, and love using Franks Buffalo Wing sauce.

text:
I LOVE this recipe!!! I made it for the first time last night. I wanted to test it out before making it for a get-together. My boyfriend, my dad, and I ate almost half the dish! It was sooo good. I made a few variations: I used low-fat, store-brand cream cheese and it worked just as well as regular, brand-name cream cheese. I also mixed the shredder cheddar cheese inside and also topped the dish with some so the top layer was a layer of cheese. I also mixed all of the ingredients on the stove-top (low heat), then put it into a baking pan and stuck it in the oven for about 20 minutes.

text:
I always get compliments on this dip. I would highly recommend using boneless, skinless chicken breasts versus canned chicken. I boil three chicken breasts in water until they were cooked, drain the water, and then shred with a fork. I have also made this in the crock-pot (low for 2-3 hours) and it tastes just as delicious (as long as you don't mind the orange color)

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/5677176.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
I have made this dip several times now.  I have made a couple of small changes to the recipe.  First, I do not use canned chicken, I boil 2 or 3 chicken breasts and then chop them up very finely.  I use my chopper from Pampered Chef and it works perfectly.  It almost minces the chicken so that you get a little chicken in every bite.  Second change is that I use half a cup of ranch and half a cup of blue cheese.  I serve with tortilla chips or chicken in a biscuit crackers.  It's awesome!

userID:
463612
Display Name:
Lala

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/75729.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
I am constantly getting requests to make this!  I do make some alterations, by using a package of chicken tender cutlets and I par boil them.  Then drain the water off, cut the chicken in to pieces, and throw them in the pan with 1 stick butter and 1 cup hot sauce.  Cook it for a few minuets so get the hot sauce absorbed into chicken, pour it over the cream cheese into a crock pot and finish the rest of the recipe.  I take the crock put it in the oven at 400 degrees until the cheese on top is a bit brown and bubbly.  Then keep it warm in the crock pot and serve with tortilla chips.

text:
This dip made a good addition to my super bowl party, but I made a few changes:  I used blue cheese dressing instead of ranch.  It overwhelmed the flavor of the dip so I would not do this again.  Next time I will use half blue cheese and half ranch or all ranch.  Second, I used velveeta instead of shredded cheese.  I'm not sure if I liked that change either, so I will probably try the shredded cheese next time.  Overall, I would give my version of this recipe 4 stars, but I'm giving 5 stars since I think my dip would have been better if I had stuck with the original recipe.  Thanks for the great dip idea!!

A simple but easy to make recipe! text:
Very good basic recipe! I doubled and made it for a bacheleurette party, the girls ate it all night and there was not a bit left by morning! I did substitute the canned chicken with Sam's Member's Mark Grilled Mesquite Breast Fillets thawed and shredded. I also don't care for store bought ranch, so I made my own using buttermilk, sour cream, mayo and a packet of Hidden Valley Dry Seasoning! I threw it the crock pot, as it keeps it nice and hot for a party, and topped it with four cheese mexican cheese, yummy!

text:
Good stuff!  I used 3/4 Cajun Chef Louisiana Wing sauce and 1/4 Stubb's Wicked Chicken WingSauce.  Also cut back the cream cheese to one 8 oz package, my preference for consistency.  Used bleu cheese dressing instead of Ranch and added a bit of blue cheese crumbles  to the top before baking.  Omitted the shredded cheddar altogether.  Used 2 frozen chicken breasts instead of canned chicken but I think canned would have been ok if it was all I had on hand.  I'll surely make again and probably add a 3rd chicken breast next time for a thicker, less saucy result.

https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/5674165.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
I love this recipe! I used 1/2 cup of ranch and 1/2 cup of blue cheese (instead of a fully cup of ranch), and then served it with Blue Corn tortilla chips. Yum! Also, instead of using a crockpot, I just put it in a small casserole dish and popped it in the oven on 350 for about 15 minutes or so, just to help solidify it. I am not a lover of super-spicy things, and this dip is just right: the hot sauce is flavorful but not overpowering. I'll definitely bring it to our next football get-together! Oh, and P.S. the leftover dip, after being refrigerated, heats up really well!

city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
Delicious, and always a hit.  I used boneless, skinless chicken breasts simmered with garlic and onion.  I also added garlic and onion to the cream cheese mixture. I used a mix of ranch dressing and neufchatel cheese, and stirred in some blue cheese crumbles, as well.  Instead of stirring it all together, I layered it in a pie plate.  The cream cheese/ranch/bleu cheese layer was first, then the chicken/buffalo sauce, then cheese on top.  I baked it in the oven at 350 till it was bubbly and slightly brown on top.  Everyone always loves it.

text:
Cream cheese can be reduced significantly without affecting the end result too much (I once cut it in half).  Also, no one can tell the difference when reduced fat cream cheese and ranch are used...and I think it actually turns out better that way.  I love this recipe!
(Other buffalo chicken dip recipes tend to suggest bleu cheese, which I find disgusting and can pick out immediately.  Thanks for not including that nastiness in this recipe!)

I love this recipe.  I make it every time I have a party to go to.  You can substitute blue cheese dressing for the ranch as well.  A couple things I change are that I use the 1/3 less fat cream cheese, light ranch dressing, and no cheese.  This recipe is so good that you don't need the extra cheese.  This recipe is definitely a keeper.

text:
I had read that a few people had separating issues, I only got this when I used the "bargain brand" cheese. I love this recipe. Some use crackers, we use golden tortilla chips. The nice thick ones. I make is stove top..Basically putting everything in a big pot until it is melted. I do let the canned chicken simmer alone long enough to remove some of the water and then I let it cook in the hot sauce before I add the cheese. But I do not do the layer in the oven thing because it takes longer and is tastes no different.

I won't make this again- back to artichoke dip for me!

This is a great dip!  I mix all ingredients into a deep pie dish, bake it in a 350 degree oven for about 30 minutes, stir to combine everything to a nice smooth consistency, then add a little bit of cheddar cheese on top, put it back in the oven until the topping is melted and bubbly.  Super easy and Everyone always LOVES IT!

country:
None
text:
I made this for a playgroup today and everyone really liked it!    I used 2 cans of 13oz chicken, drained, and broken it up with a fork.  I also used 1 cup of Buffalo wing sauce.  I think this makes it not as spicy as the Red Hot.  I put it in a crockpot on low, and within an hour it was bubbly and ready to be served.  After that I turned the crockpot down to the warm setting.   We served with tostitoes chips.  I also tried it with Pita Chips, and those tasted good as well!  This wasn't really spicy at, which I can't handle.  Just the right amount of spice, without having to grab a drink of water after every bite.    I highly highly recommend this recipe.  Serves alot of people as well!

This recipe is great! I used 1.5 lbs of cooked chicken tenders instead of the canned meat. Canned meat just creeps me out! I also used monterey jack cheese along with the cheddar, and tobasco to taste. I don't like things spicy so i just mixed in a tablespoon at a time until i reached the heat level i like. I made it ahead of time for a party, baked it for about 30 minutes at 350 degrees, and then broiled it for the last 2-3 minutes to get a browned crust.

text:
Great dip.  I used ranch as the recipe calls.  However, I followed another reviewer's recommendation and I layered the ingredients in a pan (didn't use crock pot) to avoid the strange orange color.  I placed the ranch and cream cheese on bottom, then chicken mixed with the hot sauce and topped it all off with the cheddar cheese.  I baked at 350 for 20 minutes.  It was a huge hit at a Super Bowl party.

city:

region:

country:
None
text:
This recipe doesn't need another review, but here's one anyway.  Very, very tasty!  I used roasted chicken instead of canned, but didn't substitute anything else (although I did cut the recipe in half, since there are only two of us and as is we'll be eating it all week).  I did cheat a little on prep:  I microwaved the chicken and hot sauce for a minute, added the dressing and cream cheese, microwaved for another minute, mixed in all of the cheddar and then baked at 350 for 10-15 minutes.  My oven runs hot, so on an oven that actually cooks at the correct temp, it might take as long as 20 minutes to achieve hot bubblyness.  I'm curious to try it as written, because I thought when the dip came out of the oven it was a bit runny, but it firmed up as it cooled a bit.

text:
Great dip! This went over well at my Superbowl party. I only used one 8-oz. package of cream cheese, used bleu cheese instead of ranch, measured the hot sauce only to taste, and baked it rather than slow-cooked it. It's fattening as all get-out, so it's really rich, but I think it was a 9 out of 10. It should definitely be served hot, I'd say. The recipe made a ton, so I had a lot left over from my gathering of about 10 people. I will make again. Thanks for the recipe!

text:
I only gave this recipe 4 stars b/c I made SLIGHT variations--this is wildly popular with guests!  I only use 1 pack of the cream cheese, I mix white italian cheese (mozzarella or whatever i have on hand) as well as Cheddar/Jack Mix.  In addition to this I add about 1 tbs. butter (maybe less)--I found that this prevents the coagulated cheese effect--I put ALL ingredients in the crock pot (start with softened cream cheese to get it melting), and add the cheese slowly.  Superbowl party hit!

text:
We all loved the taste of this dip.  However, the two times I've made it I left it in the crock pot to keep warm. When doing this, the Frank's Red Hot Sauce seperates from the cream cheese mixture and looks oily (I'm sure it's the moisture from the crockpot lid and the fact that it never completely congeals with the cream cheese mix.   I had this dip at a party and took it off of the heat and served from a bowl.  I just think it's better when warm.

https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/5614248.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
Wow...this was really yummy!!!!  Much easier than preparing traditional buffalo chicken wings too.  Canned chicken meat always sounded gross to me, so I bought a ready made rotisserie chicken from the grocery store and shredded the meat - great time saver.  I didn't bother with heating the chicken in the pan...really not necessary.  Just mixed everything up in a bowl, poured in a baking dish, topped with remaining cheddar cheese and baked at 350 until heated through and bubbly (about 25-30 minutes).  Great served with slices of french bread and Ritz crackers.  I'll definitely keep this one in mind for the Super Bowl, but I'm sure I'll make it many times before then :)

text:
I made this buffalo chicken dip for a holiday party that I just had, and when it filled an entire slow cooker, I was a bit nervous that I would have tons of leftovers, since we were serving a number of other dishes as well. This was not the case. Everyone complimented me on this recipe. My friend, who hates anything spicy, couldn't stop eating it. Needless to say, it was gone halfway into the evening, and I've had several requests for this recipe.
Best part of this recipe is that it's extremely easy to estimate and just 'throw in' the ingredients. I may have gone a little heavy on some ingredients, but it turned out great! I'll definitely be making this again.

text:
I was disappointed with this recipe after all the good reviews.  I made this for a family gathering and ended up with much of it to take home.  I followed the recipe to a T. The cheese left the top standing in grease.  The ranch/wing sauce flavor was just ok.  I have found an alternate recipe that I like alot the recipe uses much of the same ing. it just omits the ranch and cheddar and uses sour cream, blue cheese dressing and provolone cheese mixed in. I prefer it as a cold dip but the recipe calls for baking either way is very tasty.

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/6229350.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
Ok. We all know it's easy to feed our friends and co-workers fattening foods...I mean they will eat any free food right?  Well, I work with very picky people and took this to an employee retreat in the Wisconsin Dells.  I took other reviewers suggestions and avoided canned chicken.  I poached three FROZEN chicken breasts in water seasoned with salt, pepper, bay leaf and onion for about 20 minutes.  VERY convenient.  I used low-fat cream cheese, and a combination of fat-free ranch and fat-free blue cheese dressing.  This cuts the fat considerably, since I did use REAL Wisconsin cheddar cheese.  Needless to say everyone gobbled up this dip, even those "on a diet this summer".  I just reminded them how much fat I cut out!  Also, the first time I tried this recipe, I used Uncle Dougies Chicago-Style hot wing marinade.  It was as good as using Franks Hot Sauce, though I admit Franks is REALLY good.  I recommend trying this recipe.  Definitely bake it onsit if possible.  It just tastes great.  Thanks again for a fabulous appetizer.

text:
I love this dip, but I am with NYPD K9 COP in that I don't care for canned meats, so I use shredded cooked chicken breast for this.  Sometimes I substitute the hot sauce for salsa and serve with tortilla chips for a little Tex-Mex taste.  I also use reduced fat cream cheese and light ranch dressing--although this may cause the dip to separate just a bit more.  I do the reduced-fat version for us at home but make the regular version for parties and other get-togethers.  You won't be sorry if you make this for your next party!  It will be gone!!!!  One more variation for a celery-hating husband--I use a small chopped onion instead.

text:
We made this dip for our Memorial Day Picnic and it was the rave among all other dips that day!I did as the others suggested and layered the ingredients and accidently made the ranch dip with 2 cups of sour cream. When i realized what I had done, I combined the 2 bricks of cream cheese and ranch dip in my big mixer and mixed it up. It was fine. We cooked the chicken in a little butter as suggested. With the extra dip we served it too with chips and it was a hit too! I gave this recipe out a dozen time that day. Best new dip this year!
Marla

country:
None
text:
Buffalo Chicken Dip is a great tasting dip if made properly.  This particular recipe calls for waaaaay too much ranch dressing.  If you use the full cup it calls for it just overwhelms everything and that includes the buffalo sauce flavor(which is hard to do).  I would say about 1/4 cup of ranch dressing would be about right (blue cheese even better).  I  also had to use more hot sauce than the recipe called for.  If possible, use shredded or chopped up chicken breasts instead of the canned stuff.  Once in the dip I couldn't hardly see it or taste it.
Review:

Yummy, yummy, YUMMY.  My new football half-time favorite.  Very easy recipe with just a few ingredients but with an awesome outcome! I had 13oz. cans of chicken meat so I added three 8-oz blocks of cream chees and 1 cup of hot sauce.  Also, like other reviewers, I mixed the ranch with half bleu cheese dressing.  A great way to enjoy the taste of buffalo wings without all the mess.

city:

region:

country:
None
text:
I just made this recipe last night.  Everyone loved it!!  I made a few changes as suggested by some reviewers.  
I used Boneless skinless chicken which I grilled. Light Cream Cheese & Ranch.  
I layered it in an 8x8 pan.  Cream Cheese/Ranch Mixture.  Chicken and Frank's Redhot. Then 1.5 cups of colby jack cheese on top.  Baked 350 for 20 minutes.  Absolutely perfect.  I dabbed the top with papertowels to help reduce the grease.  Worked Great! I served it with tostidos and celery.  Celery was a defenite hit! Surprisingly! Not too spicey for anyone.  Cannot wait to make it again!

city:

region:

text:
We're conflicted. I love bleu cheese, my husband HATES it. My husband loves spicy, not too spicy for me. I made this last night, but cut the recipe in 1/2. I used canned chicken, bleu cheese dressing (not too chunky) and no extra cheddar cheese (he's not a big hot cheese eater). I poured in the Franks hot sauce little by little to make it not too spicy for me, but still with a kick and ended up using about 1/4 cup (for 1/2 recipe). We ate it hot on Chicken and Biscuit crackers and both thought it was OK. We just ate it cold and I liked it soooooo much better. My husband thought it was better, but still OK and that's when I confessed there was bleu cheese in it. I'll try it again with cooked chicken, but will definitely keep it as a cold recipe.

text:
I Love this dip. I did make quite a few changes though. I used blue cheese dressing then I added about 1/3 cup of crubled blue cheese to intesify the blue cheese flavor.  I used boneless skinless chicken breast instead of canned(hate that stuff!) and I added a 1/2 teaspoon of cayenne pepper (I like it really spicy) and I added a 1/2 cup of finely chopped celery for some texture. Then I used tortilla chips for dipping  The results were excellent!

userID:
949690
Display Name:
MEXICOTRACEY
isPro:

0

recipesCount:

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/5674169.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
I make this dip for potlucks and EVERY time I make it, I get multiple requests for the recipe.  I cook 2-3 boneless skinless chicken breasts on the stovetop until it's no longer pink and the juices run clear.  Then I chop it using my Pampered Chef food chopper, it doesn't get any easier than that!  I use about 1-1/2 cup of Frank's Red Hot, 2 blocks of cream cheese, 1 cup of light Hidden Valley Ranch dressing and 2 cups of shredded sharp cheddar cheese.  It's so easy and ALWAYS a HUGE hit!  Everyone requests it whenever there's a potluck.  Oh - I heat and mix everything on the stovetop, then transfer to a crock pot.  Turn it on the lowest setting and it stays warm and yummy for hours!

This is great!  The first time I made this, I "halved" everything just to make sure I would like it. It was wonderful and I will make for all of our parties.

userID:
497756
Display Name:
Mama Cass
isPro:
False
followersCount:
19
followingCount:
0
madeRecipesCount:
276
favoritesCount:
248
recipesCount:
0
reviewsCount:
0
photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/5614250.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
I made several changes to this recipe but loved the results!  First, I substituted a package of Perdue turkey shortcuts (2 cups of meat) for the canned chicken and used reduced fat cream cheese.  I limited the hot sauce to 1/2 cup, which was ideal for my family and guests.  Instead of transferring the dip to a crockpot, I placed it in a baking dish and popped it into the oven so the cheddar on top looked nice and bubbly.  We enjoyed the crackers and celery with the dip but surprise, surprise - my 4-year-old decided to dip an apple slice, and we loved the sweet taste with the spicy dip!
Review:
Rating:
5
dateLastModified:
2007-02-16T07:05:04.767

Everyone loves it, plain and simple.  I always serve with both chicken in a biscuit crackers and celery, and usually go a little heavier on the hot sauce.  Thanks for the recipe!

text:
I brought this dip to my friend's Superbowl party and it was a definite hit!  I layered the ingredients as recommended by other reviews and I also boiled and shredded my chicken.  I baked it for about 20 minutes at 350 degrees & broiled it for an additional 3 minutes to give a nice, golden color to the cheese.  I served this dip with tortilla chips & celery but a friend of mine also used french bread for her dip.  If you like boneless buffalo wings, you'll love this dip!

without a doubt the most popular dip i've ever made - had to have made it over 50 times. i have friends from d.c. to chicago making it.  people are disappointed when it's not made.  frank's makes the dip and don't be afraid to up it to one cup for a little more bite.  best served with fritos scoops (2 bags to be safe) but really can be served with anything.  ran out of scoops last time and people started dipping pretzels, bread sticks and by the end even their fingers...well maybe not their fingers.  anyway props to whoever came up with this simple yet addictive recipe.

Well, I served this at a "Spice of Life" party last night and it was awesome. On my end, I do not do measuring cups and spoons very well..I am more of a grab and dump til it looks right kind of girl. I did rinse and drain the chicken and I also mixed the cream cheese, ranch, red hot and then added a couple of spoons of sour cream for kicks in the microwave before adding the chicken. I let it sit overnight in the fridge and then put it in the crock pot for an hour. It is 8am and my nieces are smearing the rest between flour tortillas for me to put on the grill!

text:
I did this using the microwave and the oven, since I didn't have time for the crock pot. I microwaved the cream cheese and the salad dressing (I used a premium blue cheese dressing) for 2 minutes. I used boneless skinless breasts that I just chopped using the food processor. I followed what everyone said and used less cheese. This was AWESOME. It was better after it had set for a few minutes and cooled off, since it was less drippy. The guys loved it and fought over it.

This was awesome.  My husband was very leery of the whole idea when I told him what I was making for our New Year's Eve party.  However, it was gobbled up and I think my husband ate the most.  It tastes exactly like buffalo wings.  We had it with celery and tostitos.  I doubled the recipe for everything except the cream cheese, we used three instead of four. Excellent recipe...going in the keeper box!

I love this recipe..but I've made a few changes.  I use 4 large cans of chicken...1 1/2 cups of Ranch and 1 cup of celery chopped. text:
The first time I made this, I put it all in the slow cooker as the recipe states, but it looked gross.  So I changed it to a layered dip: cream cheese and hot sauce as first layer, chicken and dressing as second layer, and some shredded cheese on top (1/2 to 1 cup).  Then I microwaved the whole thing for about 5 minutes.  It looked a lot better and didn't separate.

city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
This was the first recipe from this site that I had complete success with.  It was easy, and was the first food item to be finished at a crawfish boil we had in New Orleans.  The spiciness was just right.  And it was most popular with the men.  Three men asked me for the recipe and I had to write it down for them.  Another woman called me for the recipe the day after.  It would be great to serve during football season! It's not much to look at, but once people try it, it goes quickly.  The recipe makes a lot. I mixed half Ranch and half blue cheese dressings and the flavor was not too strong for the non-blue cheese eaters.  I also toasted some pita bread that I cut into triangles, brushed butter on them, sprinkled them with salt, then toasted them in the oven.  They were great for holding up to the dip.  Celery worked well, too.  Thank you for posting this recipe.  I'll use it often and I'm sure I'll pass it around!

LOVED IT!!!!!! I made this on Christmas eve... it was the biggest hit of all.  I followed a tip of another review by using actual chicken breasts, and used a full cup of hot sauce.  I also used blue cheese dip rather than ranch.  I did not use a slow cooker, but rather put it into a casserole dish in the oven.  It turned out awesome. There were only 7 people over, and there was almost nothing left.  No one could walk away from it.  I did not try the canned chicken, but would totally recommend using chicken breast instead.  Also served with natcho chips...

This is a very easy recipe to make.  Not only is easy to make but its delicious.  I made it for a crab feast we went to this past weekend.  There were a total of 12 people there and everyone loved it so much that there was nothing to bring home but the empty dish. Try it you won't be sorry and neither will the people you make it for.

text:
This recipe was a toss up since I love "Buffalo" style anything, but not cream cheese.  I went ahead and used 1 cup of Frank's to finish off what was left in the bottle and I added 1 can of black beans (to give it more substance).  Instead of canned chicken, which I don't like, I used some rotisserie chicken.  To my suprise, this was really good...but the vinegar from all of the hot sauce was a bit too much. Next time I'll stick with the right amount.  All in all, I would make this again to serve to company.  Thanks for sharing.

city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
I made this dip for my husband who loves hot wings.  He loved it.  I used low fat cream cheese and low fat ranch dressing.  Because there is so much flavor in this recipe, I didn't feel that the lighter ingredients were a detriment.  I made the dip in a pot on the stove, poured it into a casserole, topped with the cheddar cheese and microwaved it until the cheese was melted.  If you like spicy foods, you will enjoy this dip.
